content: are planned well in advance and go beyond this approximate two-week time frame. This chapter does not distinguish between scheduled and planned outages. Preventing unscheduled, scheduled, and planned outages was addressed by the IBM Z system design for many years. IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ and IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ systems have a fixed size HSA of 160 GB. This size helps eliminate pre-planning requirements for HSA and provides the flexibility to update dynamically the configuration. You can perform the following tasks dynamically:4  Add a logical partition (LPAR)  Add a logical channel subsystem (LCSS)  Add a subchannel set  Add a logical PU to an LPAR  Add a cryptographic coprocessor  Remove a cryptographic coprocessor  Enable I/O connections  Swap processor types  Add memory 4 Some pre-planning considerations might exist. For more information, see Chapter 8, “System upgrades” on page 319. Chapter 9. Reliability, availability, and serviceability 377  Add a physical
